Description: Official permit ('firman') confirming the appointment of Henry Salt to the post of British Consul in Egypt, dated 23 December 1815. Imperial cipher at the top, flanked by floral motifs. Note at end to Governor General of Egypt. This is a fine manuscript with exquisite Arabic calligraphy and watercolour and gold floral decorations. With it is a translation (now preserved in a perspex cover), perhaps contemporary, of the contents (but far too long for the 5-line manuscript).
Curator's comments: The 'Bartholomew (?)Ferrier' referred to in this document, English minister at the Porte, is Bartholomew Frere.
